```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(tidyverse)
library(lubridate)
library(janitor)
library(ggplot2)
library(calecopal)
```


```{r data, echo=FALSE}

## workshops
dsc17_21_wkshps <- read_csv("data/dsc_2017_21_workshops.csv")
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r byyear, echo=FALSE}
dsc17_21_wkshps %>% 
  count(year=year(date), name="count") %>% 
  write_csv("data/workshop_year.csv")
```

```{r}
dsc_2017_21_workshops %>% 
  filter(date > as_date("2021-01-01") & date < as_date("2021-12-31")) %>% 
  count(month(date))
```
